name: Swiss Army
description: Addition to REDCap's External Module framework that provides control over custom hooks and plugins, successfully creating a Swiss Army Knife of novel REDCap tools that can be enabled per project basis. This Swiss Army Framework was created for the REDCap Spanish group hakacthon of 12/19, and it includes translation features, and end-user documentation. The current version contains 7 new features, created by a total of 8 different authors. Please read the documentation for a complete list of new features included in this version.

system-settings.name:
@MPV: translate all "*must provide value" labels into either Spanish, Portuguese, German, or French, within Surveys and Data Entry Forms
Usage: @REQUIRED={ESP}
Valid options: ESP, POR, GRM, FRN, and ENG
Author: Ed Morales (PHS) emorales7@partners.org

@COND-LISTS: REDCap hook that copies values entered in any of two or more radio buttons/drop down sub-lists to another hidden field that contains all the options of the former ones. It acts in the form of selecting a continent and then a country within that continent.
Author: Victor Espinosa (Island Health) victor.espinsa@viha.ca

Add Action Tag Descriptions: REDCap hook that includes every action tag, enabled on the Swiss Army Framework, to be included on REDCap's Action Tag Description window. The goal is to provide end-users with a venue of learning more about these action tags.
Author: Ed Morales (PHS) emorales7@partners.org

Themes Hook: Select from six different themes to change REDCap's background. The included themes are: 1), 2), 3), 4), 5, 6) REDCap original theme.
Requirement: The plugin named 'Themes UI' must be enable too.
Author: Ed Morales (PHS) emorales7@partners.org

Advance Tools user interface: plugin, added to the Online Designer, containing documentation of how the Swiss Army Tools are used, including UIs for Advanced Tools.
Author: Ed Morales (PHS) emorales7@partners.org

PHI Autochecker: Plugin that identifies fields that contain keywords of PHI and allows user to enable them as identifiers by clicking a button. It achieves this by downloading the project's data dictionary, flagging the fields, and uploading the data dictionary, by the click of a button.
Author: Luis Sanchez - REDCap Spanish Group - luischipper@gmail.com

Themes UI: User interface of the Themes Hook that provides themes options to the end-user's projects.
Notice: this is only the UI to the Themes Hook. Please enable these two tools together if you want to allow users to change REDCap's theme in their projects. The plugin gives the user the option of resetting the theme back to REDCap's theme.
Author: Ed Morales (PHS) emorales7@partners.org

Plugin Template: sample plugin, added to the Online Designer's Advanced Tools, that contains underlying code showing how to add plugins to the Swiss Army Framework.
Author: Ed Morales (PHS) emorales7@partners.org
